channel.title: Europe on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Europe on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: After a very slow start, Europe’s reusable rocket program shows signs of life
item.description: Although Themis is making progress, the program is several years behind schedule.

item.title: Right-Wing Influencers Are Turning to Foreign Affairs
item.description: Conservative creators are increasingly focusing on foreign policy. Whether they’re emissaries from or to the US isn’t always entirely clear.

item.title: Right-Wing Influencers Are Turning to Foreign Affairs
item.description: Conservative creators are increasingly focusing on foreign policy. Whether they’re emissaries from or to the US isn’t always entirely clear.

item.title: Ignoring Trump threats, Europe hits Google with 2.95B euro fine for adtech monopoly
item.description: The EU could seek to break up Google’s ad division.

item.title: Big Tech Companies in the US Have Been Told Not to Apply the Digital Services Act
item.description: The FTC notified companies like Google, Meta, and Apple that they must not apply the Digital Services Act, which regulates digital platforms, if it jeopardizes the freedom of Americans.

item.title: Big Tech Companies in the US Have Been Told Not to Apply the Digital Services Act
item.description: The FTC notified companies like Google, Meta, and Apple that they must not apply the Digital Services Act, which regulates digital platforms, if it jeopardizes the freedom of Americans.

item.title: A Crypto Micronation Is Making Friends at the White House
item.description: With Chinese crypto billionaire Justin Sun as its prime minister, Liberland hopes to make strides in international diplomacy and finally settle the parcel of forestland it claims to own.

item.title: A Crypto Micronation Is Making Friends at the White House
item.description: With Chinese crypto billionaire Justin Sun as its prime minister, Liberland hopes to make strides in international diplomacy and finally settle the parcel of forestland it claims to own.

item.title: Google confirms it will sign the EU AI Code of Practice
item.description: The company is not looking to make new enemies in Europe.

item.title: Some VMware perpetual license owners are unable to download security patches
item.description: Customers will get patches at unspecified “later date,” Broadcom says.

item.title: The Enshittification of American Power
item.description: First Google and Facebook, then the world. Under Trump 2.0, US statecraft is starting to mimic the worst tendencies of Big Tech.

item.title: The Enshittification of American Power
item.description: First Google and Facebook, then the world. Under Trump 2.0, US statecraft is starting to mimic the worst tendencies of Big Tech.

item.title: Win for Apple as EU Backs Down on Digital Services Tax
item.description: The European Commission appears to have reversed its plans to impose a significant digital tax on large technology companies, including Apple. The change was confirmed in a draft document circulated w
